Article: SAN FRANCISCO â Global billings by North American semiconductor equipment suppliers declined on a sequential basis in September for the fourth straight month in what the SEMI trade association described as a typical third quarter lull. The three-month average of fab tool billings in September was $2.09 billion, up 1.8% from September 2017 but down 6.5% compared to the final August billings level of $2.37 billion, SEMI said. Since peaking in May at $2.7 billion, monthly equipment billings have declined by 23%.
